name: Img + text scroll (Live Transcript)
description: Displays audio playback information (e.g., for a podcast, audiobook, or lecture) alongside a real-time, scrolling text transcript. This is used to synchronize spoken words with written text.
examples: I want to listen to the podcast with a transcript.
Can I see the text for that part of the lecture you just mentioned?
Show me the live subtitles for this audiobook.

component_title.description: A header or category for the content (e.g., 'Now Playing', 'Lecture Transcript').

text_heading.description: The main title of the audio content (e.g., 'Episode 101: The Future of AI').

background_img.description: The path to the cover art for the audio content (podcast, audiobook, etc.).

text_list.description: An array of transcript entries, where each object represents a line of spoken text.

content_time.description: The timestamp (MM:SS) in the audio when this line of text is spoken.

content_name.description: The name of the person speaking this line. Intended to be displayed in bold.

text_description.description: The actual transcribed text spoken at the corresponding timestamp.
